FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acidulated Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in Germany to lower PH levels without resorting to chemicals. Lowers mash pH levels, lightens color, improves flavor stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste. Intense flavor - so limit use. Low diastatic power so must be mashed with well modified malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Smooth, Intensely Malty|COLOR CONTRIBUTION: Rich Golden Hues|CHARACTERISTICS AND APPLICATIONS|Munich-style malt that will contribute an intensely malty flavor and aroma.|Use in any beer style for additional maltiness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use at 10-25% to produce a light colored, mild flavored, dry beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Biscuit (Mout Roost 50) (18° - 27° L) |This toasted malt will provide a warm bread or biscuit flavor and aroma and will lend a garnet-brown color. Use 5-15% maximum. No enzymes. Must be mashed with malts having surplus diastatic power.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted black barley adds a strong burnt coffee flavor - suitable for stouts and porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Coffee, Intense Bitter, Dry|COLOR: Deep Brown|provides color and rich, sharp flavor characteristic of Stouts and some Porters|a dryness to Stout or Porter. not interchangeable with Black Malt|Use 3-7% for a dry Porter|Use 5-15% for dry Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark roasted black malt. Also known by the German name Farbmalt or Farbmalz. Use in many dark German styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR Neutral|CHAR:Use for color adjustment|Provides color and sharp, almost acrid, flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters|Use 1-10% for desired color in Porter and Stout.|has a distinctive malty flavor not interchangeable with Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Bonlander Munich Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Smooth Malty and Sweet|Color: Golden-Orange Hues|Sufficient enzymes for self-conversion|Smooth yet pronounced malty flavor plus sweetness|Great in Bock beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Malty|Smoother, less grainy flavor than 6-row

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Grainy Malty|More husk than 2-row, well suited for high adjunct brewing

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 20 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 20* (19° - 27° L) |Dingemans Cara 20 is a light crystal malt used by Belgian breweries in producing Abbey or Trappist style ales and is appropriate for any recipe that calls for crystal malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 45 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 45* (40° - 54° L) |Dingemans Cara 45 is a medium-amber crystal malt that will impart a rich, caramel-sweet aroma and full flavor, as well as intense color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 8 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 8 (6°-9°L)is a very light crystal malt made by drying barley malt at low temperatures.The result is a malt that will lend body, smoother mouth-feel, and foam stability.This malt must be mashed with other kilned malts due to the lack of enzymes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium colored caramel malt. Bocks, dark ales, red and amber lagers and ales.|Improves flavour stability and enhances colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark caramel malt with aromatic properties. Adds deep red color and aroma. Amber ales, dark lagers, bocks. Substitute for "Belgian Special B" or 120L caramel malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma. De-husked, smoother tasting

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavor. Adds body, color, aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavour. Dark version. Adds color and aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafoam (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Carafoam (also called Carapils) adds body and head retention without substantially altering flavor. Up to 10% for light beers, 40% for mashed beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carahell (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light colored caramel malt. Adds body, color and aroma. Use up to 30% in low alcohol beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 10L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel|Golden Color|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 120L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes|Deep Red Color|3-15% in Amber &Red beers.|10-15% in Bock|7-15% in Dark beers|10-15% in Porter &Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel|Golden Color|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 30L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee|Golden Color|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 40L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee|Golden to lighr red hues|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 50L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel|Golden to lighr red hues|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 60L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel|Deep Golden to Red color|3-7% in Pilsener for balance|5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers|CHAR|glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 80L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune|Red to Deep Red|3-15% in Amber and Red beers.|10-15% in Bock beers.|7-15% in Dark beers.|10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt 90L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune|Red to Deep Red|3-15% in Amber and Red beers.|10-15% in Bock beers.|7-15% in Dark beers.|10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt, Dark (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark German crystal malt. Adds body, color and flavor. A typical German crystal malt. Also sold under the name "Caramel Dunkel".

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt, Light (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light crystal malt. Adds body and aroma. More dry in flavour than English light crystals. Also sold under the name "Caramel Hell".

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Munich 60L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Roasted, Malty|Amber to Red Color|Excellent in IPAs, Pale Ales, Oktoberfests and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Rye (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Vienne 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Malty|Golden Color|contributes both mild caramel sweetness and maltiness.|Excellent in Vienna-style Lagers and Belgian-style Abbey Ales.|Produced from AMBA/BMBRI recommended 2-Row Malting Barley varieties.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, aroma, color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, body, aroma and color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: None|COLOR: None|ITEM NUMBERS AND PACKAGING OPTIONS|adds body, foam retention, and beer stability without influencing color or flavor.|non-fermentables to balance body and flavor of dark beers|Low usage of 1-5% will help achieve desired resu

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German carapils/carafoam malt. Used in many beers for better head retention and body. Can be used up to 25% for low alcohol beers. Also sold under the German name "Caramel Malz Pils"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium crystal malt, adds a body and reddish color. Red ales and lagers, Scottish ales. Full body and aroma, deep red colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carawheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in wheat beers and ales. A wheat version of crystal malt. Promotes fuller flavor, wheat malt aroma and enhanced color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee|COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage|color adj with minor/no flavor contribution|1-10% for color in Porter &Stout|The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts &|other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor.|Use for: Brown ales, porters, some stouts|Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: (300°-380° L)malt is a high-nitrogen malt that is roasted at temps to 450°F and then rapidly cooled when the desired color is achieved."Chocolate"refers primarily to the malt's color,not its flavor.will lend various levels of aroma,a deep red color,and a

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Chocolate Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee|COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage|color adj with minor/no flavor contribution|1-10% for color in Porter &Stout|The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts &|other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Rye Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Wheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocholate malt made with a wheat base. Adds aroma and color. Alts and dark wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: produce a beer with a mild, less malty flavor|produce a drier, more crisp beer.|APPLICATIONS|Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Dark (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune|Red to Deep Red|3-15% in Amber and Red beers.|10-15% in Bock beers.|7-15% in Dark beers.|10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Extra Dark (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.|Very Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Light (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt, De-Bittered (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-Bittered Black Malt (Mout Roost 1400) (500° - 600° L) |Using an exclusive evaporative process, Dingemans De-Bittered Black Malt will contribute the same color characteristics as Black malt with a less astringent flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maris Otter (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Premium base malt from the UK. Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoidin Malt (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aromatic malt from Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoidin Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Red colored malt that improved head retention and stability. Used in red lagers, ales, dark beers. Intense red colour and malty aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Ashburne Mild Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Malty and Sweet|COLOR CONTRIBUTION: Rich Golden Hues|CHARACTERISTICS AND APPLICATIONS|Well suited for mild ale beers for color and maltiness.|Imparts smooth sweet flavor while also adding a full malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Munich(4°-7°L)malt undergoes higher kilning temperatures than pale malt.The resulting malt will lend a full, malty flavor and aroma, and an orange-amber color.This malt can make up to 100% of the grain bill, unsuitable to convert adjuncts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt 10L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Robust Malty|COLOR: Golden to Orange Hues|Adds a pronounced malty flavor without adding non-fermentables or affecting foam.|Small amounts added to the grist will improve the malty flavor and give a richer color to low gravity brews.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Robust Malty|COLOR: Golden to Orange Hues|Adds a pronounced malty flavor without adding non-fermentables or affecting foam.|Small amounts added to the grist will improve the malty flavor and give a richer color to low gravity brews.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Munich malt. May be used as a base for many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker Munich Malt. Used as a base malt in many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks and ales. Enhances malt flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Fine munich base malt from Germany. Creates malty flavor and copper color, used as a base for many German styles. Enhances flavour, aroma and colour. Also sold under the German name "Munchner Malz"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use at 5-25% to produce a lan Oatmeal Stout|Use a small percentage in Belgian Wit Beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all English beer styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale Ale (2.7° - 3.8° L) |Dingemans Pale Ale malt is fully modified and is easily converted by a single-temperature mash. This is the preferred malt for ales of all types. This malt is interchangeable with British pale ale malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Malty|Color Golden Hues|Can be used as a base malt.|More pronounced malty flavor than 2-Row Brewers Malt.|Use with 2-Row Brewers Malt for rich malt flavor and additional color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale base malt for all ales and lagers. Good general purpose malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale Wheat (1.2° - 2.0° L) |Dingemans Pale Wheat may be used in amounts ranging from 30 - 70% of the total grist to create many styles of wheat beer and in smaller amounts to aid in head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsen Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsen (1.4° - 1.8° L) |Light in color and low in protein, Dingemans Pilsen is produced from the finest European two-row barley. This malt is well modified and can easily be mashed with a single-temperature infusion.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsen Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Subtle Malty, Delicately Sweet|Very light colored base malt.|Produces exceptionally clear, crisp wort.|Pilsen Malt has a slightly lower protein level than 2-Row Brewers Malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner Malt (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light pilsner base malt from Germany. Used in continental pilsners, lagers and pale ales. Well modified - to avoid lengthy protein rests

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt for all pilsners, lagers. Highly modified malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Hulls, Rice (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Rice Hulls are a filtering aid that improve the speed of vorlauf and lautering.|Rice Hulls are particularly effective when brewing high gravity beers with a big grist; beer made with high percentages of specialty malts; and wheat and rye beers.|APPLICA

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Coffee, Intense Bitter|COLOR: Red to Deep Brown|Use 3-7% for coffee flavor in Porter and Stout|Use 2-5% in Nut Brown Ales.|Use Chocolate Malt or Black Malt in combination with Roasted Barley to obtain desired color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Deep roasted barley - adds the dry bitter flavor characteristic of Irish and Imperial Stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Wheat Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted Wheat (Tarwe Mout Roost 27) (10° - 14° L) |Dingemans Roasted Wheat is a slightly roasted wheat that will lend nutty, bread-like flavors.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Distinctive Rye, Earthy|COLOR: Deep Red Hues|Because of its pronounced rye flavor, we using in 5% increments until desired flavor is achieved.|Rye Malt is fully modified. It performs well in a single temperature infusion mash if used at less t

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Rye malt for rye style beers. Up to 50% may be used in some rye styles. Adds distinctive rye flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist to create Rye Beer.|Start at 5-10% and increase in increments of 5% because of the concentrated flavor of Rye Flakes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Smoked malt used in Rauch beers, Bamburger specials. Provides strong smoky flavor. Also sold under the German name "Rauchmalz".

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Smoked flavor and aroma base malt. Used in smoked ales, lagers and wheat beers, primarily German styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Special B (140°-155°L)darkest of the Belgian crystal malts,will impart a heavy caramel taste and is often credited with the raisin-like flavors of some Belgian Abbey ales.Larger %s(greater than 5%) will contribute a dark brown-black color and fuller body

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Victory Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Biscuity, Baking Bread, Nutty|COLOR: Deep Golden to Brown Hues|With an aroma of baking bread, Victory® Malt is great in Nut Brown Ales and other dark beers.|Special processing develops the biscuity, baking bread, nutty flavors that are distinc

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Vienna malt from Germany. Gives a lovely golden straw wort and unique vienna flavor. Also sold under the name "Weiner Malz"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Malty, Very Slight Biscuit|Can be used as a base malt|Use with Caramel Malts to produce malty red and amber beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Vienna base malt - used in many continental beer styles. Full bodied, golden color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Red (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Creamy, Sweet, Malty, Wheat, Floury|Imparts malty flavor not obtainable from raw wheat.|Use with rice hulls to improve lautering and help prevent stuck mash.|White Wheat Malt contributes to foam production and foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Flaked (Generic)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist|Use in the production of Belgian Wit Beers|Use 0.5-1.0% to a standard brew to increase foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, White (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Creamy, Sweet, Malty, Wheat, Floury|Imparts malty flavor not obtainable from raw wheat.|Use with rice hulls to improve lautering and help prevent stuck mash.|White Wheat Malt contributes to foam production and foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark wheat malt base for Dunkels and other dark wheats. Also sold under the name "Weizenmalz Dunkel" in Germany.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Light (Hoepfner)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light wheat base malt. Use in wheat beers, hefeweizen and Belgian wit styles. Also sold under the German name "Weizenmalz Hell".

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Pale (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.
